snippet: A Long Island kosher caterer has been accused of preparing nonkosher food in kosher kitchens, and he responds that the claims are part of an extortion plot.
abstract: Minority owners in Mineola, NY, kosher catering firm owned by Scott Morrell file lawsuit claiming that Morrell used kosher kitchens at three Long Island synagogues to prepare nonkosher food to be served elsewhere; Tom Cataldo and Michael Savitsky claim that the conduct, which would make all food from the kitchens nonkosher, reduced the value of the business.
lead_paragraph: A Long Island kosher caterer has been accused of preparing nonkosher food in kosher kitchens, and he responds that the claims are part of an extortion plot.

headline.seo: N.Y. Caterer and Ex-Workers Fight Over Kosher Compliance
headline.main: That Wasn’t Kosher, a Lawsuit Says
headline.print_headline: That Wasn’t Kosher, a Lawsuit Says
